title: Africa: Health Needs to Be Front and Centre of National Plans to Fight Climate Change
description: [WHO] Ahead of the UN Climate Change Conference (COP-28), WHO has published its "2023 review of health in nationally determined contributions and long-term strategies" highlighting the actions needed to ensure that people's health is fully prioritised and integrated into national plans to fight climate change.

title: Africa: At COP28, More Failure Is Not an Option for Vulnerable Communities
description: [MSF] Too little is being done to protect the most vulnerable people against the negative impacts of climate change, warns Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF). World leaders gathering in Dubai for the COP28 conference on climate change must take urgent measures to protect the health of the most affected communities.

title: Africa: First Malaria Vaccines Arrive in Cameroon - Other Countries to Follow
description: [Unicef] Shipments of the world's first WHO-recommended malaria vaccine, RTS,S, have begun with 331,200 doses landing last night in Yaoundé, Cameroon. The delivery is the first to a country not previously involved in the malaria vaccine pilot programme and signals that scale-up of vaccination against malaria across the highest-risk areas on the African continent will begin shortly.

title: Africa: Renewed Push for Countrywide SAGCOT Model in Order 'To Feed Africa By 2030'
description: [Daily News] While Tanzania is envied for having immense opportunities for agricultural development, doubtful farming stakeholders are arguing that without joining forces and using proven experience of institutions like SAGCOT, modern agricultural development will not be realised as quickly as it is perceived.

title: Africa: The Risk of Politicization of AGOA's Expanded Rules of Origin for North African Countries
description: [allAfrica] Earlier this month, United States Senator Chris Coons publicly released a discussion draft for proposed legislation that would extend the African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) beyond 2025.

title: Africa: China's Past and Present Ties With African Ruling Parties
description: [VOA] Johannesburg, South Africa -- Political analysts and opposition politicians in Africa accuse China of undermining the spread of democracy in the region by propping up entrenched ruling parties and promoting what Beijing sees as the advantages of one-party rule.

title: Africa: Regional Security Analysts Say Africa At Risk of Drone Terrorism
description: [VOA] Abuja, Nigeria -- Security experts in Africa are raising concerns about the growing use of drones by terrorist groups and the readiness of government forces to match their sophistication.

title: Africa: Step Up Investment to End Violence Against Women and Girls - UN Deputy Chief
description: [UN News] UN Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohamed has called for greater investment in preventing violence against women and girls, an issue that transcends all borders and cultures.

title: Africa: Sharp Decrease in Climate Finance Going to Small-Scale Farmers - New Report Shows
description: [IFAD] Ahead of COP28, the UN's International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) urges global leaders to shift gears and drastically and urgently scale-up climate finance for small-scale farmers and small agribusinesses, who produce one third of the world's food and up to 70 percent of the food in low- and middle-income countries. Many are brutally impacted by climate change.

title: Africa: African Football Doesn't Take Itself Seriously
description: [Scrolla] Bafana Bafana lost to Rwanda on Tuesday afternoon on a pitch that was so bad that the game should have been called off.

title: Africa: Malaria Vaccine Shipments to Africa Mark Progress Toward Broader Rollout
description: [WHO] More than 330 000 doses of WHO-recommended RTS,S malaria vaccine arrived last night in Cameroon - a historic step towards broader vaccination against one of the deadliest diseases for African children Malaria burden is the highest on the African continent, which accounted for approximately 95% of global malaria cases and 96% of related deaths in 2021 With several African countries now finalizing roll-out plans, an additional 1.7 million doses are set for delivery to Burkina Faso, Liberia, Niger and Sierra

title: Africa: Global Cooperation On Climate Change - What Have We Achieved and What Needs to Happen Next?
description: [IPS] New York -- Climate change has been a source of concern among the international community since the 1970s. Yet, almost fifty years since the issue was first raised in international diplomatic circles by prominent scientists, the situation continues to deteriorate, with rises in temperatures and extreme weather causing ever-magnifying problems around the world.

title: Africa: Indigenous Voices and Food Systems Lead the Way At COP28
description: [IPS] Nairobi -- In a groundbreaking development, indigenous farmer communities are poised to bring the spotlight onto food systems at the upcoming UN Climate Conference (COP28) in Dubai.

title: Africa: G20-Led Africa Summit Stresses 'Colossal' Investment Need
description: [DW] African leaders used the G20 Compact with Africa summit in Berlin to call attention to Africa's "colossal" need for more investment and for "positive competition" between Europe and China.

title: Africa: Call On World to Pay Attention to Desertification in Africa
description: [DW] African delegates at a UN sponsored meeting in Uzbekistan urged the international community not to neglect desertification in Africa because of conflicts around the world. They emphasized the need to take climate action.

title: Africa: Shipments to African Countries Herald Final Steps Toward Broader Vaccination Against Malaria
description: [Unicef] Shipments of the world's first WHO-recommended malaria vaccine, RTS,S, have begun with 331,200 doses landing last night in Yaoundé, Cameroon. The delivery is the first to a country not previously involved in the malaria vaccine pilot programme and signals that scale-up of vaccination against malaria across the highest-risk areas on the African continent will begin shortly.

title: Africa: No Compelling Evidence That Air Purifiers Prevent Respiratory Infections - New Study
description: [The Conversation Africa] The COVID pandemic led to many calls for improved indoor air quality with claims that doing so would reduce the risk of the virus spreading. But the real-world evidence to support these claims has been lacking and studies undertaken during the pandemic have not yet been reported.

title: Africa: How Do Viruses Get Into Cells? Their Infection Tactics Determine Whether They Can Jump Species or Set Off a Pandemic
description: [The Conversation Africa] COVID-19, flu, mpox, noroviral diarrhea: How do the viruses that cause these diseases actually infect you?

title: Africa: Calls for Reparations for Colonial Injustices Grow Louder
description: [DW] In Africa, countries impacted by the slave trade and colonial-era abuses are raising their voice to demand compensation for historical injustices.

title: Africa: Improving Livestock Health Is a Net Positive Move Towards Net Zero
description: [IPS] Brussels, Belgium -- The recent downturn in sales of alternative meat products is only the latest evidence that the world is unlikely to give up animal protein completely in the long run.
